question.body: Which is more soluble in water, oxygen or carbon dioxide?

response.feedback: Correct. Because of its molecular structure, CO2 is more than 20 times more soluble in water than oxygen.
Incorrect. O2 is poorly soluble in water. As a result we need hemoglobin to carry oxygen.
